title: As a User, I want there to be a 7 Day Limit on Negotiating Windows
custom_preconds:
Wire:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=request_form_-_inquiring_org_-_preliminary
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Employee+Permission+Request+Form+-+Inquiring+Club
GIVEN an employee Permission Request exists
custom_steps: WHEN the Inquiring Club is entering Proposed Dates and Times on a Request
custom_expected:
THEN there should be a 7 day maximum on the negotiating window
AND on Submit, there should be a rule to check to confirm the Negotiating Window is not more than 7 days
AND if the check fails, an error should fire notifying the user why they are unable to submit

title: As a User, I want there to be a 7 Day Limit on Negotiating Extension Windows
custom_preconds:
Wire:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=request_form_-_inquiring_org_-_approved
Data Discovery:
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3773130/Data+Discovery+-+Employee+Permission+Request+Form+-+Inquiring+Club+Approved
GIVEN an Employee Permission Request Extension exists
custom_steps: WHEN the Inquiring Club is entering Proposed Dates and Times on a Request Extension
custom_expected:
THEN there should be a 7 day maximum on the negotiating window
AND on Submit, there should be a rule to check to confirm the Negotiating Window is not more than 7 days
AND if the check fails, an error should fire notifying the user why they are unable to submit

title: As a Club User, I want to view an Employee Permission Requests widget
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as a Club
AND the Club User has the ebis-widget-clubeepermissionreq

Wire:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=permission_requests_-_club

Data Discovery:
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3789625/Data+Discovery+-+Permission+Requests+-+Club
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the Permission Requests tab on the Employees Dashboard
custom_expected:
THEN on this tab they will see a Permission Requests widget
AND the widget will match the provided wire and data discovery
AND club users will only see incoming requests where they are selected as the Current Org Contact.
AND they will only see Outgoing requests they created.

title: As a Club User, I want to Designate an Employee Negotiator
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as Club User

Wire:
https://82lvmf.axshare.com/#p=authorized_signatory_negotiator
https://82lvmf.axshare.com/#p=edit_an_authorized_signatory_negotiator
custom_steps: WHEN on the Signatories & Negotiators widget
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a new "Emp Negot"
AND the column will be located after the "Negot" column
AND this column will be editable and changes made to it will be saved when the widget is saved

title: As a User, I want to be stopped from editing a Permission Request if it past the end of the Negotiating Window
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as a Club
AND viewing a Permission Request after the end date and time of the Negotiating window
BUT isn't yet expired

Wire:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=request_form_-_inquiring_org_-_extension_approved
custom_steps: WHEN clicking "Edit"
custom_expected:
THEN when saving the system will launch a blocking message:
--Title      | Warning
--Body     | Negotiating Window Has Ended.
--Hint      | You may not edit the request after the close of the negotiating window.
--Buttons | Back
AND clicking "Back" will dismiss the modal
AND the Request's status will be updated to 'Expired'

title: As a User, I want to be stopped from editing a Permission Request if it past the end of the Negotiating Extension Window
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as a Club
AND viewing a Permission Request after the end date and time of the Negotiating Extension window
BUT isn't yet expired

Wire:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=request_form_-_inquiring_org_-_extension_approved
custom_steps: WHEN clicking "Edit"
custom_expected:
THEN when saving the system will launch a blocking message:
--Title | Warning
--Body | Negotiating Extension Window Has Ended.
--Hint | You may not edit the request after the close of the negotiating window.
--Buttons | Back
AND clicking "Back" will dismiss the modal
AND the Request's status will be updated to 'Expired'

title: As a Club User, I want to Receive an Email the day before the expiration of an Employee Permission Request
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an approved Employee Permission Request exists
AND a batch has been created to generate email notifications
AND current date is the day before the expiration date of the Employee Permission Request
custom_steps: WHEN the batch runs at 11:00 AM on the day prior to the expiration of an Employee Permission Request
custom_expected:
THEN the Inquiring Club Contact User, as well as all users entered as Current(receiving) Club Contacts on the Request and the designated employee negotiator, should receive an email notification
AND email should show:
**Subject:** Employee Permission Request Expiring Soon
**Content:** The employee permission request submitted for [Employee First] [Employee Last] is set to expire on [End Date] at [End Time]. Please log into EBIS to review.
AND the email should contain a link to the Permission Request

title: As a Club User, I want to Receive an Email the day before the expiration of an Extension Period on an Employee Permission Request
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an approved Employee Permission Request exists
AND an Extension request has been approved for it
AND a batch has been created to generate email notifications
AND current date is the day before the Extension Period Expiration on the request
custom_steps: WHEN the batch runs at 11:00 AM
custom_expected:
THEN the Inquiring Club Contact User, as well as all users entered as Current(receiving) Club Contacts on the Request and the designated employee negotiator should receive an email notification:
AND email should show:
**Subject:** Employee Permission Request Expiring Soon
**Content:** The extension period on the employee permission request submitted for [Employee First] [Employee Last] is set to expire on [Extension End Date] at [Extensions End Time]. Please log into EBIS to review.
AND the email should contain a link to the Permission Request

title: As a Club User, I want to see Resolution Columns added to my Permission Requests widget
custom_preconds:
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Permission+Requests+-+Club
Wire:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=permission_requests_-_club
GIVEN a club user is logged in with permission to access the Permission Requests Widget
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the Permission Requests Widget
custom_expected:
THEN there should be two new columns added to the end of Club's Permission Requests widget, as depicted in the wire
AND the columns should be titled:
  - Resolution
  - Post Extension Resolution
AND these columns should display the value entered in the respective field on the corresponding employee permission request

title: As a former Employee Negotiator, I want to continue seeing and receiving emails and notifications for requests I am named on
custom_preconds:
(Business Value:
If an Org changes Employee Negotiators while an Employee Request is in flight, the Negotiator that was included on the request when it was created should continue being the designated negotiator.)

GIVEN an Employee Permission Request is in flight (status > Preliminary)
custom_steps: WHEN a user changes the Employee Negotiator for their org
custom_expected:
THEN the original negotiator should continue seeing the request on their Employee Permission Request widget
AND the original negotiator should continue receiving clipboard notifications about the request
AND the original negotiator should continue receiving emails about the request

title: As an Inquiring Club User, I want to Create a New Employee Permission Req. Form
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a Club User

Wire:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=request_form_-_inquiring_org_-_preliminary

Data Discovery:
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3789356/Data+Discovery+-+Employee+Permission+Request+Form+-+Inquiring+Club
custom_steps: WHEN there will be a Create New Request button on the Employee Permission Requests widget
custom_expected:
THEN clicking the button will open a new Employee Permission request in Edit Mode
AND the request will match the provided wire and data discovery

title: As an Inquiring Club User, I want to Save an Employee Permission Req. Form
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in as a Inquiring Club User, a save button will be available anytime the form is in edit mode

Wire:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=request_form_-_inquiring_org_-_preliminary

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Employee+Permission+Request+Form+-+Inquiring+Club
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking save
custom_expected:
THEN the current values will be stored and the Request will reload in view mode
AND After a successful save the system will display a successful save blue notification
BUT If the Request was a new request that had not been save previously, it will be given a status of Preliminary

title: As an Inquiring Club User, I want to Edit a Preliminary Employee Permission Req. Form
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as a CLUB
AND that Club has made a Preliminary Employee Permission Req

Wire:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=request_form_-_inquiring_org_-_preliminary

Data Discovery:
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3789356/Data+Discovery+-+Employee+Permission+Request+Form+-+Inquiring+Club
custom_steps: WHEN opening the Preliminary Permission Request
custom_expected:
THEN an Edit button will be available anytime the form is in view mode if the form is in Preliminary State and the viewing user has edit permissions
AND clicking Edit will reload the form in edit mode 
AND in Edit mode 2 button will be available,    Save  |  Cancel

title: As an Inquiring Club User, I want to submit an Employee Permission Request to Another Club
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as a CLUB

Wire:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=request_form_-_inquiring_org_-_preliminary
https://82lvmf.axshare.com/#p=authorized_signatory_negotiator

https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3789356/Data+Discovery+-+Employee+Permission+Request+Form+-+Inquiring+Club
custom_steps: WHEN viewing a New or Preliminary Employee Permission Requests
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a Submit button on new and Preliminary Employee Permission Requests
AND clicking Submit will perform a required field check
AND if the required field check passes, the Request's status will update to Pending
AND the Request will now appear on the Employee Permission Request widget for the user chosen as the Current Org Contact
AND the Request will also appear on the widget for any user from the Current Org that has the "Emp Negot" column checked for them on the Signatories & Negotiators widget
AND the system will generate a clipboard notification for the Current Org Contact notifying them that a new Employee Permission Request has been submitted

title: As an Inquiring Club User, I want to enter a resolution on an Active Employee Permission Request
custom_preconds:
GIVEN Inquiring Club logs in 
AND an Active Employee Permission Request exist
custom_steps: WHEN clicking an Active request from the Employee Permission Request widget
custom_expected:
THEN system will open the Request in View mode
AND There will be an Edit button which, when clicked, will load the form into edit mode
AND When the form loads the only editable field will be "Resolution" and the Inquiring Club Comments
AND If the user selects 'Extension Requested" from the Resolution dropdown, the following fields will become visible to be edited:
  -- Start Day
  -- Start Time
  -- End Day
  -- End Time
AND There will be a Save button that allows the User to save the entered resolution
AND If 'Extension Requested' is selected as the resolution, the Save button will turn into a 'Submit Extension'

Wires:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=request_form_-_inquiring_org_-_approved

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=143365890

title: As an Inquiring Club User, I want to Submit an Extension Request on an Active Employee Permission Request
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as a CLUB
AND has made made a Permission Request Inquiry  

Wires:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=request_form_-_inquiring_org_-_approved
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=request_form_-_receiving_org_-_extension_pending

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=143365890
custom_steps: WHEN "Extension Requested' is selected as the resolution on an Active Employee Permission Request,
custom_expected:
THEN the Save button will turn into a 'Submit Extension' button
AND clicking this button will update the Requests status to "Pending (Ext)"
AND the system will generate a clipboard notification to the Receiving Club Contact notifying them an extension has been requested
AND the Receiving Club will see the new status reflected on their Permission Request Widget
AND the request will be reloaded into view mode for the Inquiring club and they will not have an Edit button

title: As an Inquiring Club User, I want to enter a Post Extension Resolution on an Active Employee Permission Request
custom_preconds:
Wires:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=request_form_-_inquiring_org_-_extension_approved
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=143365890
GIVEN a user is logged in with Employee Permission Request perms
AND user has navigated to the Employee Permission Request widget
custom_steps: WHEN user clicks an Active (Ext) request from the Employee Permission Request widget
custom_expected:
THEN system should open the Request in View mode
AND there should be an Edit button which, when clicked, should load the form into edit mode
AND when the form loads the only editable field should be "Post Extension Resolution" and the Inquiring Club Comments
AND there should be a Save button that allows the User to save the entered resolution

title: As an Inquiring User, I want to Receive an Email if an Employee Permission Request I Submitted is Denied
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has submitted an Employee Permission Request
custom_steps: WHEN the Employee Permission Request is denied
custom_expected:
THEN the Inquiring Club Contact user should receive an email notification:
AND email should show:
**Subject:** Employee Permission Request Denied
**Content:** The employee permission request submitted for [Employee First] [Employee Last] has been denied. Please log into EBIS to review
AND the email should contain a link to the Permission Request

title: As an Inquiring Club User, I want to Receive an Email if an Employee Permission Request I Submitted is Approved
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has submitted an employee permission request
custom_steps: WHEN the Employee Permission Request is approved
custom_expected:
THEN the Inquiring Club Contact user, should receive an email notification
AND the email should show:
**Subject:** Employee Permission Request Approved
**Content:** The employee permission request submitted for [Employee First] [Employee Last] has been approved. Please log into EBIS to review.
AND the email should contain a link to the Permission Request

title: As an Inquiring User, I want to Receive an Email if an Extension Request on an Employee Permission Request I Submitted is Denied
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an active Employee Permission Request exists
AND an extension has been requested for it
custom_steps: WHEN the Extension Request is denied
custom_expected:
THEN the Inquiring Club Contact user should receive an email notification:
AND the email should show:
**Subject:** Employee Permission Extension Request Denied
**Content:** **Content:** The extension for [Employee First] [Employee Last]'s employee permission request has been denied.  Please log into EBIS to review.
AND the email should contain a link to the Permission Request

title: As an Inquiring Club User, I want to Receive an Email if an Extension Request on an Employee Permission Request I Submitted is Approved
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an active Employee Permission Request exists
AND an extension has been requested for it
custom_steps: WHEN the Extension Request is approved
custom_expected:
THEN the Inquiring Club Contact user should receive an email notification:
AND the email should show:
**Subject:** Employee Permission Extension Request Approved
**Content:** The extension for [Employee First] [Employee Last]'s employee permission request has been approved.  Please log into EBIS to review.
AND the email should contain a link to the Permission Request

title: As a Receiving Club User, I want to view a Pending Employee Permission Request that has been sent to me
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as a CLUB
AND viewing the Employee Permission Request widget

Wires:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=permission_requests_-_club
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=request_form_-_receiving_org_-_pending

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Employee+Permission+Request+Form+-+Receiving+Club
custom_steps: WHEN clicking the status of a Pending Request from another Org
custom_expected:
THEN the form will open the Request in Edit mode
AND the form will match the provide wire and data discovery
AND the Receiving Club will be able to edit Employee Type and Current Club Contacts
AND there will be an "Add Contact" link and when clicked, a new Club Contact dropdown will be added
AND clicking the trash can will remove the contact
AND there will be a new [Club] Comments box for the Receiving club to add comments to the request
AND there will be a Save button and Cancel Button

title: As a Receiving Club User, I want to Deny a Pending Employee Permission Request that has been sent to me
custom_preconds:
GIVEN Inquiry club user Submits an Employee Permission Request
AND Receiving Club user logs in
custom_steps: WHEN Receiving club user views the Pending Employee Permission Request
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a Deny button
AND Clicking the Deny button will prompt the user to confirm the action
AND If the User confirms, the form will refresh in view mode
AND The Request's status will be updated to "Denied"
AND The system will generate a clipboard notification to the Inquiring Club Contact notifying them the Request has been denied
BUT  If the User denies, the modal will be dismissed and they will be returned to the form

Wires:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=request_form_-_receiving_org_-_pending

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Employee+Permission+Request+Form+-+Receiving+Club

title: As a Receiving Club User, I want to Approve a Pending Employee Permission Request that has been sent to me
custom_preconds:
GIVEN Inquiry club user Submits an Employee Permission Request
AND Receiving Club user logs in
custom_steps: WHEN Receiving club user views the Pending Employee Permission Request
custom_expected:
THEN there will be an Approve button
AND Clicking the Approve button will prompt the user to confirm the action
AND If the User confirms, the form will refresh in view mode
AND The Request's status will be updated to "Active"
AND The system will generate a clipboard notification to the Inquiring Club Contact notifying them the Request has been approved
BUT If the User denies, the modal will be dismissed and they will be returned to the form

Wires:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=request_form_-_receiving_org_-_pending

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Employee+Permission+Request+Form+-+Receiving+Club

title: As a Receiving Club User, I want to Deny an Extension Request
custom_preconds: GIVEN Receiving Club logs in
custom_steps:
Wires:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=request_form_-_receiving_org_-_extension_pending

AC:
 - When the Receiving Club opens a Request in "Pending (Ext)" state, there will be a Deny button
 - Clicking the Deny button will prompt the user to confirm the action
  -- If the User confirms, the form will refresh in view mode
  -- If the Extension is denied prior to the original expiration date, the status will be updated to "Active (Ext Denied)"
  -- If the Extension is denied after the original expiration date, the status will be updated to "Expired"
  -- The system will generate a clipboard notification to the Inquiring Club Contact notifying them the extension request has been denied

  -- If the User denies, the modal will be dismissed and they will be returned to the form
 - There will be no required field check when Deny is clicked

title: As a Receiving Club User, I want to grant an Extension Request
custom_preconds:
Wires:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=request_form_-_receiving_org_-_extension_pending
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=request_form_-_inquiring_org_-_extension_approved
GIVEN a club user is logged in with Employee Permission Request perms
AND an Extension Request has been submitted to the user's club
custom_steps: WHEN the Receiving Club opens a Request in "Pending (Ext)" state
custom_expected:
THEN the form should open in Edit mode
AND the only fields that should be editable are the Confirm checkbox in the Resolution section and the Receiving Club's Comment box
AND there should be an inactive "Approve Extension" button when the form loads
AND when the Confirm checkbox is clicked, the "Approve Extension" button should become active
AND clicking the Approve Extension button should prompt the user to confirm the action
AND if the User confirms, the form should refresh in view mode
AND the Request's status should be updated to "Active (Ext)"
AND the system should generate a clipboard notification to the Inquiring Club Contact notifying them the extension request has been approved
AND if the User denies, the modal should be dismissed and they should be returned to the form

title: As a Receiving Club User, I want to Receive an Email every 24 hours if I have not Approved or Denied an Employee Permission Request
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an employee permission request has been submitted
AND the request has NOT been approved or denied
AND a batch has been created to send notifications
custom_steps: WHEN the batch runs
custom_expected:
THEN all users entered as Current Club Contacts on the Request, as well as the designated employee negotiator (#166744924), should receive an email notification 
AND the batch should run and generate the notifications every day at 11:00 AM
AND the email should show:
**Subject:** New Employee Permission Request
**Content:** A new employee permission requests has been submitted for [Employee First] [Employee Last]. Please log into EBIS to review.
AND the email should contain a link to the Permission Request
AND the reminder emails should continue until the request is approved, denied, or expires

title: As a Receiving Club User, I want to Receive an Email if a Resolution is entered on an Employee Permission Request
custom_preconds: GIVEN an active Employee Permission Request exists
custom_steps: WHEN a resolution is entered on the Employee Permission Request
custom_expected:
THEN all users entered as Current Club Contacts on the Request, as well as the designated employee negotiator (#166744924), should receive an email notification
AND the email should show:
**Subject:** Resolution Entered on Employee Permission Request
**Content:** A resolution has been entered on the employee permission request submitted for [Employee First] [Employee Last]. Please log into EBIS to review.
AND the email should contain a link to the Permission Request

title: As a Receiving Club User, I want to Receive an Email if an Extension is Requested on an Employee Permission Request
custom_preconds: GIVEN an Active Employee Permission Request exists
custom_steps: WHEN an extension is requested on the Employee Permission Request
custom_expected:
THEN all users entered as Current Club Contacts on the Request, as well as the designated employee negotiator (#166744924), should receive an email notification
AND the email should show:
**Subject:** Extension Requested on Employee Permission Request
**Content:** An extension has been requested on the employee permission request submitted for [Employee First] [Employee Last]. Please log into EBIS to review.
AND the email should contain a link to the Permission Request

title: As a Receiving Club User, I want to Receive an Email if a Post Extension Resolution is entered on an Employee Permission Request
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an active Employee Permission Request exists
AND an extension has been requested and granted for it
custom_steps: WHEN the post extension resolution is entered
custom_expected:
THEN all users entered as Current Club Contacts on the Request, as well as the designated employee negotiator (#166744924), will receive an email notification
AND email should show:
**Subject:** Post Extension Resolution Entered on Employee Permission Request
**Content:** A post extension resolution has been entered on the employee permission request submitted for [Employee First] [Employee Last]. Please log into EBIS to review.
AND the email should contain a link to the Permission Request

title: As a Receiving Club User, I want to add Club Contacts to an Employee Permission Request after the request has been approved
custom_preconds: GIVEN an Approved Employee Permission Request exists
custom_steps:
WHEN an Admin user from the Receiving Club logs in
AND the user navigates to the approved request
custom_expected:
THEN user should see an Edit button when a request submitted to them is in Active or Active (Ext) state
AND clicking the Edit button should load the form into edit mode
AND the only fields available for the Receiving Club to edit while the request is in Active or Active (Ext) should be the Current Club contacts
AND the user should be able to add new contacts and delete or change existing contacts

title: As a BOC User, I want to view an Employee Permission Requests widget
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC
AND has the ebis-empc-boc-admin-role permission

Wire:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=permission_requests_-_boc

Data Discovery:
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3789348/Data+Discovery+-+Permission+Requests+-+BOC
custom_steps: WHEN navigating to the Permission Requests tab on the Employees Dashboard
custom_expected:
THEN On this tab, they will see a Permission Requests widget
AND the widget will match the provided wire and data discovery
AND the widget will default to show 1 year of requests, rolling over on Opening Day.
AND 2 filters should be available to add via the filter icon:
  -- Requesting Org
  -- Receiving Org

title: As a BOC User, I want supporting documents to be available on all Employee Permission Requests
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC

Wire:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=request_form_-_inquiring_org_-_preliminary
custom_steps: WHEN viewing an Employee Permission Request
custom_expected:
THEN there will be a footer section titled "Employee Permissions Process Information" as depicted in the wire
AND there will be two PDF documents available for users to open / download
 -- Tampering Policy
 -- Interview Process for Key Baseball Positions

title: BOC User Want to Edit all Requests in Any State
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is logged in with BOC admin perms for Employee Permission Requests
custom_steps: WHEN the BOC Admin Users attempts to do anything with a request
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to edit Employee Permission Requests, regardless of state:
  -- Active
  -- Active (Ext)
  -- Expired
AND BOC Admin Users shouuld be able to edit the following sections on Employee Permission Requests while Active or Active (Ext):
-- Details Section
-- Inquiring Club Details
-- Proposed Permission Period
-- Request Resolution
AND BOC Admin Users should be able to edit the following sections on Employee Permission Requests while Expired:
-- Details Section
-- Inquiring Club Details
-- Request Resolution (May only edit Resolution and Post Extension Resolution fields)

title: As a BOC User, I want all Employee Permission Requests to Automatically Expire At The End of The Negotiating Window
custom_preconds:
Wire:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=request_form_-_inquiring_org_-_approved
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=143365890
GIVEN an approved Employee Permission Request exists
custom_steps: WHEN the conclusion of the Permission Period on the Approved Request is reached
custom_expected:
THEN the system should automatically update the status of the Request to "Expired"
AND the system should generate a clipboard notification to both the Inquiring and the Receiving Club Contacts notifying them the Permission Request has expired
AND neither Club should be able to edit the Request once it is in Expired state
BUT if there is an approved extension, there request won't expire

title: As a BOC User, I want all Employee Permission Requests to Automatically Expire At The End of The Negotiating Extension Window
custom_preconds:
Wire:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=request_form_-_inquiring_org_-_extension_approved
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=143365890
GIVEN an approved Employee Permission Request exists
AND an extension has been approved for it
custom_steps: WHEN the conclusion of the Permission Extension Period on the Approved (Ext) Request is reached
custom_expected:
THEN the system should automatically update the status of the Request to "Expired"
AND the system should generate a clipboard notification to both the Inquiring and the Receiving Club Contacts notifying them the Permission Request has expired
AND neither Club should be able to edit the Request once it is in Expired state

title: As a BOC User, I want to see Resolution Columns added to my Permission Requests widget
custom_preconds:
Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Permission+Requests+-+BOC
Wire:
https://hri2kq.axshare.com/#p=permission_requests_-_boc
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with permission to access the Permission Requests Widget
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the Permission Requests Widget
custom_expected:
THEN there should be two new columns added to the end of the of BOC's Permission Requests widget, as depicted in the wire
AND the 2 columns should be titled
  - Resolution
  - Post Extension Resolution
AND these columns should display the value entered in the respective field on the corresponding employee permission request

title: As a BOC User, I want to be notified if a club changes their designated Employee Negotiator in the Signatory widget
custom_steps:
Related to: #166744924

AC:
 - When a club changes their Employee Negotiator in the Signatory widget, BOC Users will receive a Clipboard Notification
  -- [Org] has removed [User] as an Employee Negotiator.
  -- [Org] has added [User] as an Employee Negotiator.

title: Employee Permission Requests: PERMISSIONS Part II
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is logged in as a CLUB
custom_steps:
WHEN a user has one of the following roles

 - ebis-empc-club-executive-admin-role
 - ebis-empc-club-field-personnel-admin-role
 - ebis-empc-club-front-office-admin-role
 - ebis-empc-club-scouting-admin-role
custom_expected:
THEN Club Users with any UEC Admin permissions should have access to the widget
AND all four roles should have the ebis-widget-clubeepermissionreq Permission

title: Employee Permission Requests: PERMISSIONS
custom_steps:
**New LDAP Groups:**
ebis-widget-boceepermissionreq
ebis-widget-clubeepermissionreq

**Role Assignments:**

**BOC:**
ebis-empc-boc-admin-role
 - ebis-widget-boceepermissionreq

**Club:**
ebis-empc-club-executive-admin-role
 - ebis-widget-clubeepermissionreq
